situation: N struggled with the crowded and noisy lunch hall during break time, becoming visibly anxious and teary.
action: The teacher asked N to go outside and get some fresh air, inadvertently increasing her anxiety as she feared missing lunch. The teacher left N by herself without seeking further support.
effect: N felt abandoned and confused about what to do, spending the rest of the lunch period isolated outside. The action failed to provide comfort or address her sensory overload.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
